quote: In my end is my beginning.
author: Mary Stuart

quote: The good old days were never that good  believe me. The good new days are today  and better days are coming tomorrow. Our greatest songs are still unsung.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: The past is never completely lost  khowever extensive the devastation. Your sorrows are the bricks and mortar of a magnificent temple. What you are today and what you will be tomorrow are because of what you have been.
author: Gordon Wright

quote: Fear not for the future  weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: There are two days about which nobody should ever worry  and these are yesterday and tomorrow.
author: Robert Jones Burdette

quote: We crucify ourselves between two thieves: regret for yesterday and fear of tomorrow.
author: Fulton Oursler

quote: Every saint has a past  and every sinner has a future.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When I am anxious it is because I am living in the future. When I am depressed it is because I am living in the past.
author: Anonymous

quote: I'm not convinced that the world is in any worse shape than it ever was. It's just that in this age of almost instantaneous communication  we bear the weight of problems our forefathers only read about after they were solved.
author: Burton Hillis

quote: Truth has no beginning.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The world's history is constant  like the laws of nature  and simple  like the souls of men.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: These are the stories that never  never die  that are carried like seed into a new country  are told to you and me and make in us new and lasting strengths.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: What one loves in childhood stays in the heart forever.
author: Mary Jo Putney

quote: This time  like all times  is a very good one if we but know what to do with it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In times like these  it helps to recall that there have always been times like these.
author: Paul Harvey

quote: Our ignorance of history makes us libel our own times. People have always been like this.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The good old days are neither better nor worse than the ones we're living through right now.
author: Artie Shaw

quote: Where I was born and where and how I have lived is unimportant. It is what I have done with where I have been that should be of interest.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: Respect the past in the full measure of its deserts  but do not make the mistake of confusing it with the present  nor seek in it the ideals of the future.
author: Jose Ingenieros

quote: It's a pleasure to share one's memories. Everything remembered is dear  endearing  touching  precious. At least the past is safe-though we didn't know it at the time. We know it now. Because it's in the past  because we have survived.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The events in our lives happen in a sequence in time  but in their significance to ourselves  they find their own order ... the continuous thread of revelation.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: The best compliment we can pay our past is to prophetically and bravely face today and tomorrow.
author: Bernie Wiebe

quote: Some memories are realities  and are better than anything that can ever happen to one again.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Fortunate are the people whose roots are deep.
author: Agnes Meyer

quote: As the dew to the blossom  the bud to the bee  As the scent to the rose  are those memories to me.
author: Amelia C. Welby

quote: Heirlooms we don't have in our family. But stories we've got.
author: Rose Chernin

quote: We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: The past is a guidepost  not a hitching post.
author: L. Thomas Holdcroft

quote: The past in retrospect holds manifold disenchantments  failures and even tragedies  and yet the worse may be forgotten and the best held fast.
author: W. Robertson Neicoll

quote: The road was new to me  as roads always are  going back.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: Yesterday I lived  today I suffer  tomorrow I die  but I still think fondly  today and tomorrow  of yesterday.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book shown to him by heart  and his friends can only read the title.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: We are well advised to keep on nodding terms with the people we used to be  whether we find them attractive company or not.... We forget all too soon the things we thought we could never forget.
author: Joan Didion

quote: The past is a work of art  free of irrelevancies and loose ends.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: The past is a foreign country  they do things differently there.
author: Leslie Poles Hartley

quote: The past with its pleasures  its rewards  its foolishness  its punishments  is there for each of us forever  and it should be.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The past is that which we possess fully and in whole.
author: Isidor Eliashev

quote: Our deeds still travel with us from afar  and what we have been makes us what we are.
author: George Eliot

quote: The past is the tomorrow that got away.
author: Leonard L. Levinson

quote: Our life is like some vast lake that is slowly filling with the stream of our years. As the waters creep surely upward the landmarks of the past are one by one submerged. But there shall always be memory to lift its head above the tide until the lake is overflowing.
author: Alexandre Charles Auguste Bisson

quote: Why should we grope among the dry bones of the past  or put the living generation into masquerade out of its faded wardrobe?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No past is dead for us  but only sleeping  love.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: I look back on my life like a good day's work  it is done and I am satisfied with it.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: Of all sad words of tongue or pen  the saddest are these: It might have been.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: That sign of old age  extolling the past at the expense of the present.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The past is one evil less and one memory more.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Then is then. Now is now. We must grow to learn the difference.
author: Anonymous

quote: The past not merely is not fugitive  it remains present.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The past which is so presumptuously brought forward as a precedent for the present was itself founded on some past that went before it.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: "Old times" never come back and I suppose it's just as well. What comes back is a new morning every day in the year  and that's better.
author: George E. Woodberry

quote: We have inherited new difficulties because we have inherited more privileges.
author: Dr. Abram Sacher

quote: People are always asking about the good old days. I say  why don't you say the good "now" days? Isn't "now" the only time you're living?
author: Robert M. Young

quote: Life in the twentieth century undeniably has ... such richness  joy and adventure as were unknown to our ancestors except in their dreams.
author: Arthur H. Campton

quote: Enjoy yourself. These are the "good old days" you're going to miss in the years ahead.
author: Anonymous

quote: The past is our very being.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: To disdain today is to prove that yesterday has been misunderstood.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The universe is made of stories  not of atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: This is not a dress rehearsal. This is It.
author: Tom Cunningham

quote: Only when your consciousness is totally focused on the moment you are in can you receive whatever gift  esson  or delight that moment has to
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Seize the day  and put the least possible trust in tomorrow.
author: Horace

quote: Tomorrow's life is too late. Live today.
author: Martial

quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Half of today is better than all of tomorrow.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today  because if you enjoy it today  you can do it again  tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

quote: Today is the first day of the rest of your life.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: The present moment is significant  not as the bridge between past and future  but by reason of its contents  which can fill our emptiness and become ours  if we are capable of receiving them
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: All of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It's not that "today is the first day of the rest of my life " but that now is all there is of my life.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: We want to live in the present  and the only history that is worth a tinker's damn is the history we make today.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Now is the only time we own  give  love  toil with a will. And place no faith in tomorrow  for the clock may then be still.
author: Anonymous

quote: Enjoy yourself  drink  call the life you live today your own-but only that  the rest belongs to chance.
author: Euripides

quote: You are younger today than you ever will be again. Make use of it for the sake of tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

quote: If we are ever to enjoy life  now is the time  not tomorrow or next year. ... Today should always be our most wonderful day.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: Live now  believe me  wait not till tomorrow  gather the roses of life today.
author: Pierre de Ronsard

quote: So often we rob tomorrow's memories by today's economies.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: You had better live your best and act your best and think your best today  for today is the sure preparation for tomorrow and all the other tomorrows that follow.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone He can call today his own. He who  secure within can say  "Tomorrow  do thy worst  for I have lived today."
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Forget mistakes. Forget failures. Forget everything except what you're going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day.
author: Will Durant

quote: Yesterday is ashes  tomorrow wood. Only today does the fire burn brightly.
author: Old Eskimo proverb

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: This is the day which the Lord has made. Let us rejoice and be glad in it.
author: Bible

quote: He growled at morning  noon  and night  And trouble sought to borrow  Although today the sky was bright  He knew t'would storm tomorrow  A thought of joy he could not stand  And struggled to resist it  Though sunshine dappled all the land This sorry pessimist it.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: To those leaning on the sustaining infinite  to-day is big with blessings.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The here-and-now is no mere filling of time  but a filling of time with God.
author: John Foster

quote: In the present  every day is a miracle.
author: James Gould Cozzens

quote: Life is only this place  this time  and these people right here and now.
author: Vincent Collins

quote: I believe that only one person in a thousand knows the trick of really living in the present.
author: Storm Jameson

quote: There is one thing we can do  and the happiest people are those who do it to the limit of their ability. We can be completely present. We can be all here. We can ... give all our attention to the opportunity before us.
author: Mark Van Doren

quote: The more I give myself permission to live in the moment and enjoy it without feeling guilty or judgmental about any other time  the better I feel about the quality of my work.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Act-act in the living Present!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Are not my days few? Cease then  and let me alone  that I may take comfort a little  Before I go to the place from which I shall not return.
author: Bible

quote: Now or never was the time.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: And now  Lord  what wait I for?
author: Bible

quote: The future belongs to those who live intensely in the present.
author: Anonymous

quote: The present is elastic to embrace infinity.
author: Louis Anspacher

quote: The present is the living sum-total of the whole past.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The present is an eternal now.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: The present is all the ready money Fate can give.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: The present is an edifice which God cannot rebuild.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The present is the blocks with which we build.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The present is the symbol and vehicle of the future.
author: Joseph McSorely

quote: The present is all you have for your certain possession.
author: Anonymous

quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that  all knowledge is moonshine.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Having spent the better part of my life trying either to relive the past or experience the future before it arrives  I have come to believe that in between these two extremes is peace.
author: Anonymous

quote: This time  like all times  is a very good one if we but know what to do with it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: One realm we have never conquered: the pure present.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: He who lives in the present lives in eternity.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: I am in the present. I cannot know what tomorrow will bring forth. I can know only what the truth is for me today. That is what I am called upon to serve.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: The present offers itself to our touch for only an instant of time and then eludes the senses.
author: Plutarch

quote: A life uncommanded now is uncom-manded  a life unenjoyed now is unenjoyed  a life not lived wisely now is not lived wisely.
author: David Grayson

quote: The word "now" is like a bomb thrown through the window  and it ticks.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Whether it's the best of times or the worst of times  it's the only time we've got.
author: Art Buchwald

quote: It is now  and in this world  that we must live.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Who cares about great marks left behind? We have one life.... Just one. Our life. We have nothing else.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: This-the immediate  everyday  and present experience-is IT  the entire and ultimate point for the existence of a universe.
author: Alan Watts

quote: Let us live today.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Work accomplished means little. It is in the past. What we all want is the glorious and living present.
author: Sherwood Anderson

quote: Yesterday is a cancelled check. Tomorrow is a promissory note. Today is cash in hand. Spend It!
author: John W Newbern

quote: Today Relative to Yesterday or Tomorrow The future is made of the same stuff as the present.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Yesterday is but a dream  tomorrow is only a vision. But today  well lived  makes every yesterday a dream of happiness  and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well  therefore  to this day  for it is life  the very life of life.
author: The Sanskrit

quote: Be glad today. Tomorrow may bring tears. Be brave today. The darkest night will pass. And golden rays will usher in the dawn.
author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

quote: Do not look back on happiness  or dream of it in the future. You are only sure of today  do not let yourself be cheated out of it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Existence is no more than the precarious attainment of relevance in an intensely mobile flux of past  present  and future.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow  for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
author: William Allen White

quote: The past  the present and the future are really one: they are today.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: The present contains all that there is. It is holy ground  for it is the past  and it is the future.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: There is no justification for present existence other than its expansion into an indefinitely open future.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: With the past  I have nothing to do  nor with the future. I live now.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present  which seldom happens to us.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: The past is a bucket of ashes  so live not in your yesterdays  nor just for tomorrow  but in the here and now.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Youth is the time of getting  middle age of improving  and old age of spending.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: It is not the weight of the future or the past that is pressing upon you  but ever that of the present alone. Even this burden  too  can be lessened if you confine it strictly to its own limits.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Reappraise the past  reevaluate where we've been  clarify where we are  and predict or anticipate where we are headed.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

quote: We can easily manage if we will only take  each day  the burden appointed to it. But the load will be too heavy for us if we carry yesterday's burden over again today  and then add the burden of the morrow before we are required to bear it.
author: John Newton

quote: Take in the ideas of the day  drain off those of yesterday. As to the morrow  time enough to consider it when it becomes today.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Tomorrow I will live  the fool does say  today itself's too late  the wise lived yesterday.
author: Martial

quote: The cares of today are seldom those of tomorrow.
author: William Cowper

quote: Yesterday is a cancelled check  tomorrow is a promissory note  today is the only cash you have-so spend it wisely.
author: Kay Lyons

quote: Everyman's life lies within the present  for the past is spent and done with  and the future is uncertain.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The flesh endures the storms of the present alone  the mind those of the past and future as well.
author: Epicurus

quote: I try to learn from the past  but I plan for the future by focusing exclusively on the present. That's where the fun is.
author: Donald Trump

quote: No mind is much employed upon the present  recollection and anticipation fill up almost all our moments.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The only living life is in the past and future-the present is an interlude- strange interlude in which we call on past and future to bear witness that we are living.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Past  and to come  seems best  things present  worst.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The past cannot be regained  although we can learn from it  the future is not yet ours even though we must plan for it. ... Time is now. We have only today.
author: Charles Hummell

quote: Look not mournfully into the past  it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present  it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: No longer forward nor behind I look in hope or fear  but grateful  take the good I find  the best of now and here.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: The present  like a note in music  is nothing but as it appertains to what is past and what is to come.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: We can see well into the past  we can guess shrewdly in to the future  but that which is rolled up and muffled in impenetrable folds is today.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The present time is seldom able to fill desire or imagination with immediate enjoyment  and we are forced to supply its deficiencies by recollection or anticipation.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Be satisfied  and pleased with what thou art  Act cheerfully and well thy allotted part  Enjoy the present hour  be thankful for the past  And neither fear  nor wish  the approaches of the last.
author: Martial

quote: It is difficult to live in the present  ridiculous to live in the future and impossible to live in the past.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: If you have one eye on yesterday  and one eye on tomorrow  you're going to be cockeyed today.
author: Anonymous

quote: Yesterday has gone. Tomorrow may never come. There is only the miracle of this moment. Savor it. It is a gift.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don't waste today regretting yesterday instead of making a memory for tomorrow.
author: Laura Palmer

quote: Light tomorrow with today.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I just take one day. Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not come. We have only today to love Jesus.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Patterns of the past echo in the present and resound through the future.
author: Dhyani Ywahoo

quote: Who controls the past controls the future  who controls the present controls the past.
author: George Orwell

quote: If we spend our time with regrets over yesterday  and worries over what might happen tomorrow  we have no today in which to live.
author: Anonymous

quote: Now is all we have. Everything that has ever happened to you  and anything that is ever going to happen to you  is just a thought.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: The present is the necessary product of all the past  the necessary cause of all the future.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: If we open a quarrel between the past and the present  we shall find we have lost the future.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Few of us ever live in the present  we are forever anticipating what is to come or remembering what has gone.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past  not to worry about the future  nor to anticipate troubles  but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
author: Buddha

quote: When we have a world of only now  with no shadows of yesterdays or clouds of tomorrow  then saying what we can do will work.
author: Goldie Ivener

quote: I can feel guilty about the past  apprehensive about the future  but only in the present can I act. The ability to be in the present moment is a major component of mental wellness.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: I have realized that the past and the future are real illusions  that they exist only in the present  which is what there is and all that there is.
author: Alan Watts

quote: There is no present or future  only the past  happening over and over again  now.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Today was once the future from which you expected so much in the past.
author: Anonymous

quote: Today is yesterday's pupil.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Today is yesterday's effect and tomorrow's cause.
author: Phillip Gribble

quote: Through loyalty to the past  our mind refuses to realize that tomorrow's joy is possible only if today's makes way for it  that each wave owes the beauty of its line only to the withdrawal of the preceding one.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The present is the now  the here  through which all future plunges to the past.
author: James Joyce

quote: I have everything I need to enjoy my here and now-unless I am letting my consciousness be dominated by demands and expectations based on the dead past or the imagined future.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Today is the blocks with which we build.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: In order to be utterly happy  the only thing necessary is to refrain from comparing this moment with other moments in the past  which I often did not fully enjoy because I was comparing them with other moments of the future.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Seize from every moment its unique novelty  and do not prepare your joys.
author: Andre Gide

quote: You don't need endless time and perfect conditions. Do it now. Do it today. Do it for twenty minutes and watch your heart start beating.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Do not manage as if you had ten thousand years before you. Look you  death stands at your elbow  make the most of your minute  and be good for something while it is in your power.
author: Charles Palmer

quote: And if not now  when?
author: Talmud

quote: As we are always preparing to be happy  it is inevitable that we should never be so.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Why not seize the pleasure at once? How often is happiness destroyed by preparation  foolish preparation!
author: Jane Austen

quote: When shall we live if not now?
author: M. F. K. Fisher

quote: We cannot put off living until we are ready. The most salient characteristic of life is its coerciveness: it is always urgent  "here and now " without any possible postponement. Life is fired at us point-blank.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Very few men  properly speaking  live at present  but are providing to live another time.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Freedom from worries and surcease from strain are illusions that always inhabit the distance.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: Study as if you were to live forever. Live as if you were to die tomorrow.
author: Saint Isidore of Seville

quote: The best preparation for a better life next year is a full  complete  harmonious  joyous life this year.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm  you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
author: Morris West

quote: Some people are making such thorough preparation for rainy days that they aren't enjoying today's sunshine.
author: William Feather

quote: The greater part of our lives is spent in dreaming over the morrow  and when it comes  it  too  is consumed in the anticipation of a brighter morrow  and so the cheat is prolonged  even to the grave.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: It is cheap generosity which promises the future in compensation for the present.
author: J. A. Spender

quote: Who knows if the gods above will add tomorrow's span to this day's sum?
author: Horace

quote: Defer not till tomorrow to be wise  tomorrow's sun to thee may never rise.
author: William Congreve

quote: My head is buried in the sands of tomorrow  while my tail feathers are singed by the hot sun of today.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Today  well lived  will prepare me for both the pleasure and the pain of tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

quote: The future belongs to those who live intensely in the present.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every moment that I am centered in the future  I suffer a temporary loss of this life.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: We know nothing of tomorrow  our business is to be good and happy today.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: We are always beginning to live  but are never living.
author: Manilius

quote: Live wastes itself while we are preparing to live.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I have always been waiting for something better-sometimes to see the best I had snatched from me.
author: Dorothy Reed Mendenhall

quote: Men spend their lives in anticipation  in determining to be vastly happy at some period when they have time. But the present time has one advantage over every other-it is our own.... We may lay in a stock of pleasures  as we would lay in a stock of wine  but if we defer the tasting of them too long  we shall find that both are soured by age.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: You do well to have visions of a better life than of every day  but it is the life of every day from which the elements of a better life must come.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The most effective way to ensure the value of the future is to confront the present courageously and constructively.
author: Rollo May

quote: The habit of looking into the future and thinking that the whole meaning of the present lies in what it will bring forth is a pernicious one. There can be no value in the whole unless there is value in the parts.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: You don't save a pitcher for tomorrow. Tomorrow it may rain.
author: Leo Durocher

quote: Very strange is this quality of our human nature which decrees that unless we feel a future before us we do not live completely in the present.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: Just do your best today and tomorrow will come ... tomorrow's going to be a busy day  a happy day.
author: Helen Boehm

quote: Do today's duty  fight today's temptation  do not weaken and distract yourself by looking forward to things you cannot see  and could not understand if you saw them.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Live for today. Multitudes of people have failed to live for today. ... What they have had within their grasp today they have missed entirely  because only the future has intrigued them.
author: William Allen White

quote: Present opportunities are neglected  and attainable good is slighted  by minds busied in extensive ranges and intent upon future advantages.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Light tomorrow with today.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: A preoccupation with the future not only prevents us from seeing the present as it is  but often prompts us to rearrange the past.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The man least dependent upon the morrow goes to meet the morrow most cheerfully.
author: Epicurus

quote: Today's egg is better than tomorrow's hen.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: T'were too absurd to slight for the hereafter  the day's delight!
author: Robert Browning

quote: The best part of our lives we pass in counting on what is to come.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: It seems to be the fate of man to seek all his consolations in futurity.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The prospect of being pleased tomorrow will never console me for the boredom of today.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life  not the top.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: We steal if we touch tomorrow. It is God's.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The past and present are only our means  the future is always our end. Thus we never really live  but only hope to live.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The president is the representative of the whole nation and he's the only lobbyist that all the one hundred and sixty million people in this country have.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Trying to make the presidency work these days is like trying to sew buttons on a custard pie.
author: James David Barber

quote: Th' prisidincy is th' highest office in th' gift iv th people. Th' vice-prisidincy is th' next highest an' the lowest. It isn't a crime exactly. Ye can't be sint to jail f r it  but it's a kind iv a disgrace.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: Seriously  I do not think I am fit for the presidency.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: An eminent American is reported to have said to friends who wished to put him forward  'Gentlemen  let there be no mistake. I should make a good president  but a very bad candidate.'
author: James Bryce

quote: Well  I wouldn't say that I was in the 'great' class  but I had a great time while I was trying to be great.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: The presidency does not yield to definition. Like the glory of a morning sunrise  it can be experienced - it can not be told.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: When the president does it  that means it is not illegal.
author: Richard Nixon

quote: A president's hardest task is not to do what's right  but to know what's right.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Had I been chosen president again  I am certain I could not have lived another year.
author: John Adams

quote: The four most miserable years of my life . . .
author: John Adams

quote: If you are as happy  my dear sir  on entering this house as I am in leaving it and returning home  you are the happiest man in the country.
author: James Buchanan

quote: I feel like the man who was tarred and feathered and ridden out of town on a rail. To the man who asked how he liked it he said: 'If it wasn't for the honour of the thing  I'd rather walk.'
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The office of president requires the constitution of an athlete  the patience of a mother  the endurance of an early Christian.
author: Harold Wilson

quote: Within the first few months I discovered that being a president is like riding a tiger. A man has to keep riding or be swallowed.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Harricum! Harricum! Give 'em hell  Harricum!
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: In America  any boy may become president  and I suppose it's just one of the risks he takes.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: I have no expectation of making a hit every time I come to bat.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: I think the American public wants a solemn ass as a president  and I think I'll go along with them.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: I desire to so conduct the affairs of this administration that if  at the end ... I have lost every friend on earth  I shall have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The final greatness of the presidency lies in the truth that it is not just an office of incredible power but a breeding ground of indestructible myth.
author: Clinton Rossiter

quote: I beg leave to assure the Congress that no pecuniary consideration could have tempted me to accept this arduous employment at the expense of my domestic ease and happiness. I do not wish to make any profit from it.
author: George Washington

quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Don't let it be forgot  That once there was a spot -For one brief shining moment That was known as Camelot.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The buck stops here.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: The ocean and I have many pebbles To find and wash off and roll into shape.
author: William Stafford

quote: The sea possesses a power over one's moods that has the effect of a will. The sea can hypnotize. Nature in general can do so.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Roll on  thou deep and dark blue ocean - roll! Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain  Man marks the earth with ruin - his control Stops with the shore.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The sea - the truth must be confessed - has no generosity. No display of manly qualities - courage  hardihood  endurance  faithfulness - has ever been known to touch its irresponsible consciousness of power.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Being in a ship is being in a jail  with the chance of being drowned.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The sea hath no king but God alone.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: I liked to sail alone. The sea was the same as a girl to me - I did not want anyone else along.
author: E. B. White

quote: I do not love the sea. The look of it is disquieting. There is something in the very sound of it that stirs the premonition felt while we listen to noble music  we become inexplicably troubled.
author: H. M. Tomlinson

quote: The only cure for seasickness is to sit on the shady side of an old church in the country.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have observed  on board a steamer  how men and women easily give way to their instinct for flirtation  because water has the power of washing away our sense of responsibility  and those who on land resemble the oak in their firmness behave like floating seaweed when on the sea.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: A poor woman from Manchester  on being taken to the seaside  is said to have expressed her delight on seeing for the first time something of which there was enough for everybody.
author: John Lubbock

quote: There's never an end for the sea.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: April is the cruellest month  breeding Lilacs out of the dead land  mixing memory and desire  stirring dull roots with Spring rain.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Autumn wins you best by this: its mute Appeal to sympathy for its decay.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Honest Winter  snow-clad  and with the frosted beard  I can welcome not uncordially  But that long deferment of the calendar's promise  that weeping gloom of March and April  that bitter blast outraging the honour of May how often has it robbed me of heart and hope?
author: George Gissing

quote: No one thinks of Winter when the grass is green.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: No Winter lasts forever  no Spring skips its turn. April is a promise that May is bound to keep  and we know it.
author: Hal Borland

quote: The nicest thing about the promise of spring is that sooner or later she'll have to keep it.
author: Mark Beltaire

quote: Now is the winter of our discontent Made glorious summer by this sun of York.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Every April  God rewrites the Book of Genesis.
author: Anonymous

quote: The changing year's progressive plan Proclaims mortality to man.
author: Horace

quote: Summer is the mother of the poor.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Take a winter as you find him and he turns out to be a thoroughly honest fellow with no nonsense in him: and tolerating none in you  which is a great comfort in the long run.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Summer ends  and Autumn comes  and he who would have it otherwise would have high tide always and a full moon every night.
author: Hal Borland

quote: June's too soon  July's too late - for summer.
author: Siberian saying

quote: April  Comes like an idiot  babbling  and strewing flowers.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Autumn arrives in the early morning  but spring at the close of a winter's day.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Autumn is the bite of a harvest apple.
author: Christina Petrowsky

quote: May is a pious fraud of the almanac A ghastly parody of real Spring Shaped out of snow and breathed with eastern wind.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The first day of spring was once the time for taking the young virgins into the fields  there in dalliance to set an example in fertility for Nature to follow. Now we just set the clock an hour ahead and change the oil in the crankcase.
author: E. B. White

quote: There is honor among thieves.
author: English proverb

quote: Set a thief to catch a thief.
author: English proverb

quote: A plague upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: When thieves fall out  honest men come by their own.
author: English proverb

quote: Stolen waters are sweet  and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
author: Proverbs

quote: A library is thought in cold storage.
author: Viscount Herbert Samuel

quote: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is a visible labour and there is an invisible labour.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: An Englishman thinks seated  a Frenchman  standing  an American  pacing  an Irishman  afterward.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: Analogies  it is true  decide nothing  but they can make one feel more at home.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Data data everywhere but not a thought to think.
author: Theodore Roszak

quote: One must live the way one thinks or end up thinking the way one has lived.
author: Paul Bourget

quote: One thought fills immensity.
author: William Blake

quote: Sometimes people mistake the way I talk for what I am thinking.
author: Idi Amin

quote: Thought is the labour of the intellect  reverie is its pleasure.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Three minutes' thought would suffice to find this out  . but thought is irksome and three minutes is a long time.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: When thought becomes excessively painful  action is the finest remedy.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: Worrying is the most natural and spontaneous of all human functions. It is time to acknowledge this  perhaps even to learn to do it better.
author: Lewis Thomas

quote: All thought is a feat of association  having what's in front of you bring up something in your mind that you almost didn't know you knew.
author: Robert Frost

quote: We only think when we are confronted with a problem.
author: John Dewey

quote: The extra calories needed for one hour of intense mental effort would be completely met by eating one oyster cracker or one half of a salted peanut.
author: Francis C. Benedict

quote: Every man who says frankly and fully what he thinks is doing a public service.
author: Leslie Stephen

quote: Thought is the strongest thing we have. Work done by true and profound thought - that is a real force.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: When a man knows he is to be hanged in a fortnight  it concentrates his mind wonderfully.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: We find it hard to believe that other people's thoughts are as silly as our own  but they probably are.
author: James Harvey Robinson

quote: Thinking is like loving and dying - each of us must do it for himself.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: A man of action forced into a state of thought is unhappy until he can get out of it.
author: John Galsworthy

quote: It is human nature to think wisely and to act in an absurd fashion.
author: Anatole France

quote: Men use thought only to justify their wrongdoings  and speech only to conceal their thoughts.
author: Voltaire

quote: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
author: Bible

quote: The real offence  as she ultimately perceived  was her having a mind of her own at all. Her mind was to be his - attached to his own like a small garden plot to a deer park.
author: Henry James

quote: To be uncertain is to be uncomfortable  but to be certain is to be ridiculous.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Think wrongly  if you please  but in all cases think for yourself.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: The thoughts that come often unsought  and  as it were  drop into the mind  are commonly the most valuable of any we have.
author: John Locke

quote: We shall succeed only so far as we continue that most distasteful of all activity  the intolerable labour of thought.
author: Learned Hand

quote: Profundity of thought belongs to youth  clarity of thought to old age.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Every real thought on every real subject knocks the wind out of somebody or other.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: What was once thought can never be unthought.
author: Friedrich Dilrrenmatt

quote: Many a time I have wanted to stop talking and find out what I really believed.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Man is a slow  sloppy and brilliant thinker  the machine is fast  accurate and stupid.
author: William M. Kelly

quote: Folks that blurt out just what they think wouldn't be so bad if they thought.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Facts in books  statistics in encyclopedias  the ability to use them in men's heads.
author: Fogg Brackell

quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts  wisdom lies in their simplification.
author: Martin H. Fisher

quote: The fundamental fact about the Greek was that he had to use his mind. The ancient priests had said 'Thus far and no farther. We set the limits of thought.' The Greek said  'All things are to be examined and called into question. There are no limits set on thought.'
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Thought is born of failure.
author: Lancelot Law Whyte

quote: Speaking without thinking is shooting without taking aim.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: What you think is an illusion created by your glands  your emotions and  in the last analysis  by the content of your stomach. That gray matter you're so proud of is like a mirror in an amusement park which transmits to you nothing but distorted signals from reality forever beyond your grasp.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Many highly intelligent people are poor thinkers. Many people of average intelligence are skilled thinkers. The power of a car is separate from the way the car is driven.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Belief is harder to shake than knowledge.
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: The bliss e'en of a moment still is bliss.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: Every second is of infinite value.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The bliss e'en of a moment still is bliss.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: Let me tell thee  time is a very precious gift of God  so precious that it's only given to us moment by moment.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: There are half hours that dilate to the importance of centuries.
author: Mary Catherwood

quote: This-this was what made life: a moment of quiet  the water falling in the fountain  the girl's voice ... a moment of captured beauty. He who is truly wise will never permit such moments to escape.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: We do not remember days  we remember moments.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
author: Corita Kent

quote: The span of life is waning fast  Beware  unthinking youth  beware! Thy soul's eternity depends Upon the record moments bear!
author: Eliza Cook

quote: Florence Farr once said to me  "If we could say to ourselves  with sincerity  'this passing moment is as good as any I shall ever know ' we could die upon the instant and be united with God."
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Sometimes I would almost rather have people take away years of my life than take away a moment.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: Life is not lost by dying  life is lost minute by minute  day by day  in all the thousand small  uncaring ways.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: I have the happiness of the passing moment  and what more can mortal ask?
author: George R. Gissing

quote: The sole life which a man can lose is that which he is living at the moment.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I always say to myself  what is the most important thing we can think about at this extraordinary moment.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Fill the unforgiving minute with sixty seconds worth of distance run.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The present moment is creative  creating with an unheard-of intensity.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle  which is exactly what it is: a miracle and unrepeatable.
author: Storm Jameson

quote: Who makes quick use of the moment is a genius of prudence.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: I live now and only now  and I will do what I want to do this moment and not what I decided was best for me yesterday.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: But what minutes! Count them by sensation  and not by calendars  and each moment is a day.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: It may be life is only worthwhile at moments. Perhaps that is all we ought to expect.
author: Sherwood Anderson

quote: To finish the moment  to find the journey's end in every step of the road  to live the greatest number of good hours  is wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Our latest moment is always our supreme moment. Five minutes delay in dinner now is more important than a great sorrow ten years gone.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: God speaks to all individuals through what happens to them moment by moment.
author: J. P. DeCaussade

quote: Be always resolute with the present hour. Every moment is of infinite value.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: A player's effectiveness is directly related to his ability to be right there  doing that thing  in the moment. ... He can't be worrying about the past or the future or the crowd or some other extraneous event. He must be able to respond in the here and now.
author: John Brodie

quote: We inhabit ourselves without valuing ourselves  unable to see that here  now  this very moment is sacred  but once it's gone-its value is incontestable.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: Life is all memory except for the one present moment that goes by so quick you can hardly catch it going.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: The trouble is not that we are never happy-it is that happiness is so episodical.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: Non-cooks think it's silly to invest two hours' work in two minutes' enjoyment  but if cooking is evanescent  so is the ballet.
author: Julia Child

quote: We have only this moment  sparkling like a star in our hand ... and melting like a snowflake. Let us use it before it is too late.
author: Marie Beynon Ray

quote: It is privilege of living to be ... acutely  agonizingly conscious of the moment that is always present and always passing.
author: Marya Mannes

quote: The passing moment is all we can be sure of  it is only common sense to extract its utmost value from it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: He is blessed over all mortals who loses no moment of the passing life.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: We must not wish anything other than what happens from moment to moment  all the while  however  exercising ourselves in goodness.
author: Saint Catherine of Genoa

quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: If it weren't for the last minute  nothing would get done.
author: Anonymous

quote: Once to every man and nation comes the moment to decide. ... And the choice goes by forever t'wixt that darkness and that light.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I have always felt that the moment when first you wake up in the morning is the most wonderful of the twenty-four hours. No matter how weary or dreary you may feel  you possess the certainty that... absolutely anything may happen. And the fact that it practically always doesn't  matters not one jot. The possibility is always there.
author: Monica Baldwin

quote: Every age can be enchanting  provided you live within it.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: To live exhilaratingly in and for the moment is deadly serious work  fun of the most exhausting sort.
author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quote: Love the moment and the energy of the moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
author: Corita Kent

quote: Life isn't a matter of milestones  but of moments.
author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote: The power of Thought  - the magic of the Mind!
author: Lord Byron

quote: My thoughts ran a wool-gathering.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Any man may make a mistake  none but a fool will stick to it. Second thoughts are best as the proverb says.
author: Cicero

quote: Learning without thought is labor lost.
author: Confucius

quote: I think  therefore I am.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: Thoughts that breathe and words that burn.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Great thoughts reduced to practice become great acts.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The mind grows by what it feeds on.
author: J. G. Holland

quote: A penny for your thought.
author: John Lyly

quote: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
author: Matthew

quote: As he thinketh in his heart  so is he.
author: Proverbs

quote: There is nothing either good or bad  but thinking makes it so.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Yond Cassius has a lean and hungry look  He thinks too much: such men are dangerous.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
author: Sir Philip Sidney

quote: Great thoughts come from the heart.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: It's no use filling your pocket with money if you have got a hole in the corner.
author: George Eliot

quote: A penny saved is a penny earned.
author: English proverb

quote: It is better to have a hen tomorrow than an egg today.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He that will not stoop for a pin will never be worth a pound.
author: English proverb

quote: A man who both spends and saves money is the happiest man  because he has both enjoyments.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: That great artillery of God Almighty.
author: William Temple

quote: 3 o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: All movements go too far.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Nothing is improbable until it moves into the past tense.
author: George Ade

quote: Nothing really belongs to us but time  which even he has who has nothing else.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Respect the past in the full measure of its desserts  but do not make the mistake of confusing it with the present nor seek in it the ideals of the future.
author: Josi Incenieros

quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments  And has time enough.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The passing minute is every man's equal possession but what has once gone by is not ours.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: This only is denied even to God: the power to undo the past.
author: Agathon

quote: Time is a Test of Trouble - But not a Remedy - If such it proved  it proves too There was no Melody.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Time is the rider that breaks youth.
author: George Herbert

quote: To excel the past we must not allow ourselves to lose contact with it  on the contrary  we must feel it under our feet because we raised ourselves upon it.
author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

quote: Time is a great legalizer  even in the fields of morals.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Time goes  you say? Ah no! Alas  Time stays  we go.
author: Henry Austin Dobson

quote: Let time that makes you homely  make you sage.
author: Thomas Parnell

quote: I don't ask for your pity  but just your understanding - no  not even that -no. Just for your recognition of me in you  and the enemy  time  in us all.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: All things flow  nothing abides.
author: Heraclitus

quote: When you sit with a nice girl for two hours  you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute  you think it's two hours. That's relativity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There was a young lady named Bright Who could travel much faster than light She started one day In the relative way And came back on the previous night.
author: Anonymous

quote: Longevity conquers scandal every time.
author: Shelby Foote

quote: What may be done at any time will be done at no time.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: English proverb

quote: Punctuality is the thief of time.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Enjoy the present hour  Be thankful for the past  And neither fear nor wish Th' approaches of the last.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Horus non numero nisi serenas (I count only the sunny hours).
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The only true time which a man can properly call his own  is that which he has all to himself  the rest  though in some sense he may be said to live it  is other people's time  not his.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: I want to go ahead of Father Time with a scythe of my own.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Time is a great teacher  but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: One third of the people of the world are asleep at any given moment. The other two thirds are awake and probably stirring up trouble somewhere.
author: Dean Rusk

quote: Time and I against any two.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Time discovered truth.
author: Seneca

quote: Time gives good advice.
author: Maltese proverb

quote: What a day may bring  a day may take away.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Time is a kindly god.
author: Sophocles

quote: Time goes by: reputation increases  ability declines.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Time cools  time clarifies  no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Every minute starts an hour.
author: Paul Gondola

quote: Time wounds all heels.
author: Jane Ace

quote: The apparent serenity of the past is an oil spread by time.
author: Lloyd Frankenberg

quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events  and strong is its current  no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place  and this too will be swept away.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It takes time to save time.
author: Joe Taylor

quote: The mind of man works with strangeness upon the body of time. An hour  once it lodges in the queer element of the human spirit  may be stretched to fifty or a hundred times its clock length  on the other hand  an hour may be accurately represented by the timepiece of the mind by one second.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: When you have a great and difficult task  something perhaps almost impossible  if you only work a little at a time  every day a little  suddenly the work will finish itself.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Champions know there are no shortcuts to the top. They climb the mountain one step at a time. They have no use for helicopters!
author: Judi Adler

quote: The world doesn't come to the clever folks  it comes to the stubborn  obstinate  one-idea-at-a-time people.
author: Mary Roberts Rinehart

quote: One of the greatest evils of the day among those outside of prison is their sense of futility. Young people say  What is the sense of our small effort? They cannot see that we must lay one brick at a time  take one step at a time  we can be responsible only for the one action of the present moment.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: One only gets to the top rung of the ladder by steadily climbing up one at a time  and suddenly all sorts of powers  all sorts of abilities which you thought never belonged to you- suddenly become within your own possibility and you think  "Well  I'll have a go  too."
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Let no one be deluded that a knowledge of the path can substitute for putting one foot in front of the other.
author: Mary Caroline Richards

quote: Look at a stone cutter hammering away at his rock  perhaps a hundred times without as much as a crack showing in it. Yet at the hundred-and-first blow it will split in two  and I know it was not the last blow that did it  but all that had gone before.
author: Jacob A. Riis

quote: Home wasn't built in a day.
author: Jane Ace

quote: Happiness is a tide: it carries you only a little way at a time  but you have covered a vast space before you know that you are moving at all.
author: Mary Adams

quote: Not to go back is somewhat to advance. And men must walk  at least  before they dance.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Great things are not done by impulse  but by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Well-being is attained little by little  and is no little thing itself.
author: Zeno

quote: Bigness comes from doing many small things well. ... Individually  they are not very dramatic transactions. Together  though  they add up.
author: Edward S. Finkelstein

quote: If you only keep adding little by little  it will soon become a big heap.
author: Hesiod

quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance  one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: All that I have accomplished ... has been by that plodding  patient  persevering process of accretion which builds the ant heap particle by particle  thought by thought  fact by fact.
author: Elihu Burritt

quote: If we take care of the moments  the years will take care of themselves.
author: Maria Edgeworth

quote: Many things which cannot be overcome when they are together  yield themselves up when taken little by little.
author: Plutarch

quote: True worth is doing each day some little good  not dreaming of great things to do by and by.
author: Anonymous

quote: Little by little does the trick.
author: Aesop

quote: It is by attempting to reach the top at a single leap that so much misery is caused in the world.
author: William Cobbett

quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
author: Bernadette Devlin

quote: I think and think for months  for years. Ninety-nine times the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Many strokes overthrow the tallest oaks.
author: John Lyly

quote: Much rain wears the marble.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: One thing at a time  all things in succession. That which grows slowly endures.
author: J. G. Hubbard

quote: A successful individual typically sets his next goal somewhat  but not too much  above his last achievement.
author: Kurt Lewin

quote: One sits down first  one thinks afterwards.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: We can do no great things-only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Many strokes  though with a little axe  hew down and fell the hardest-timber'd oak.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Progress is the sum of small victories won by individual human beings.
author: Bruce Catton

quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A soul occupied with great ideas performs small duties.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: The waters wear the stones.
author: Bible

quote: One step and then another  and the longest walk is ended. One stitch and then another  and the longest rent is mended. One brick upon another  and the tallest wall is made. One flake and then another  and the deepest snow is laid.
author: Anonymous

quote: You don't just luck into things. ... You build step by step  whether it's friendships or opportunities.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The way a chihuahua goes about eating a dead elephant is to take a bite and be very present with that bite. In spiritual growth  the definitive act is to take one step and let tomorrow's step take care of itself!
author: William H. Houff

quote: Victory is won not in miles  but in inches. Win a little now  hold your ground  and later win a little more.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: It is astonishing how short a time it takes for very wonderful things to happen.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: Inches make a champion.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Yard by yard  it's very hard. But inch by inch  it's a cinch.
author: Anonymous

quote: If we take care of the inches  we will not have to worry about the miles.
author: Hartley Coleridge

quote: When Ty Cobb got on first base he had an apparently nervous habit of kicking the bag. ... By kicking the bag hard enough Cobb could move it a full two inches closer to second base. He figured that this improved his chances for a steal  or for reaching second base safely on a hit.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Yard by yard  it's very hard. But inch by inch  it's a cinch.
author: Anonymous

quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: A harbor  even if it is a little harbor  is a good thing.... It takes something from the world  and has something to give in return.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: One can get just as much exultation in losing oneself in a little thing as in a big thing. It is nice to think how one can be recklessly lost in a daisy.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Life is made up of little things. It is very rarely that an occasion is offered for doing a great deal at once. True greatness consists in being great in little things.
author: Charles Simmons

quote: Life is a great bundle of little things.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Nothing can be done except little by little.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Practice yourself in little things  and thence proceed to greater.
author: Epictetus

quote: Those people work more wisely who seek to achieve good in their own small corner of the world ... than those who are forever thinking that life is in vain  unless one can ... do big things.
author: Herbert Butterfield

quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: You've got to think about "big things" while you're doing small things  so that all the small things go in the right direction.
author: Alvin Toffler

quote: Little strokes fell great oaks.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Take your needle  my child  and work at your pattern  it will come out a rose by and by. Life is like that  one stitch at a time taken patiently  and the pattern will come out all right  like embroidery.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Why not learn to enjoy the little things-there are so many of them.
author: Anonymous

quote: Human felicity is produced not so much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen as by little advantages that occur every day.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Trifles make up the happiness or the misery of mortal life.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: Even a small star shines in the darkness.
author: Finnish proverb

quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: If you don't enjoy getting up and working and finishing your work and sitting down to a meal with family or friends  then the chances are you're not going to be happy. If someone bases his happiness or unhappiness on major events like a great new job  huge amounts of money  a flawlessly happy marriage or a trip to Paris  that person isn't going to be happy much of the time. If  on the other hand  happiness depends on a good breakfast  flowers in the yard  a drink or a nap  then we are more likely to live with quite a bit of happiness.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: The big things that come our way are ... the fruit of seeds planted in the daily routine of our work.
author: William Feather

quote: The little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: Enjoy the little things  for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

quote: It is in trifles  and when he is off his guard  that a man best shows his character.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Life is denied by lack of attention  whether it be to cleaning windows or trying to write a masterpiece.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: It was only a sunny smile  But it scattered the night And little it cost in the giving  Like morning light  And made the day worth living.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sometimes the littlest things in life are the hardest to take. You can sit on a mountain more comfortably than on a tack.
author: Anonymous

quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect  and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami Sivananda

quote: The smallest effort is not lost  Each wavelet on the ocean tost Aids in the ebb-tide or the flow  Each rain-drop makes some floweret blow  Each struggle lessens human woe.
author: Charles Mackay

quote: In life's small things be resolute and great To keep thy muscle trained  Know'st thou when Fate Thy measure takes  or when she'll say to thee  "I find thee worthy  do this deed for me?"
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much  and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
author: Bible

quote: We think in generalities  but we live in detail.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something that I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: I am convinced that there are times in everybody's experience when there is so much to be done  that the only way to do it is to sit down and do nothing.
author: Fanny Fern

quote: We cannot do everything at once  but we can do something at once.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Nobody makes a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could only do a little.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: We must not... ignore the small daily differences we can make which  over time  add up to big differences that we often cannot foresee.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: A terrace nine stories high begins with a pile of earth.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Not all things are blest  but the seeds of all things are blest.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: God requires a faithful fulfillment of the merest trifle given us to do  rather than the most ardent aspiration to things to which we are not called.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Large streams from little mountains flow  tall oaks from little acorns grow.
author: David Everett

quote: Instead of thinking about where you are  think about where you want to be. It takes twenty years of hard work to become an overnight success.
author: Diana Rankin

quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The distance doesn't matter  only the first step is difficult.
author: Madame Marquise du Deffand

quote: Cultural transformation announces itself in sputtering fits and starts  sparked here and there by minor incidents  warmed by new ideas that may smolder for decades. In many different places  at different times  the kindling is laid for the real conflagration-the one that will consume the old landmarks and alter the landscape forever.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: The greatest masterpieces were once only pigments on a palette.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: It is not the straining for great things that is most effective  it is the doing the little things  the common duties  a little better and better.
author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

quote: It's a simple formula: do your best and somebody might like it.
author: Dorothy Baker

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Though thy beginning was small  yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
author: Bible

quote: Almost everything comes from almost nothing.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: From a little spark may burst a mighty flame.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Start by doing what's necessary  then what's possible  and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Saint Francis of Assisi

quote: If you wish to reach the highest  begin at the lowest.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Great issues develop from small beginnings.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Events of great consequence often spring from trifling circumstances.
author: Livy

quote: No matter how big and tough a problem may be  get rid of confusion by taking one little step toward solution. Do something.
author: George F. Nordenholt

quote: Most of the critical things in life  which become the starting points of human destiny  are little things.
author: R. Smith

quote: Sow an act  reap a habit  sow a habit  reap a character  sow a character  reap a destiny.
author: G. D. Boardman

quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it. ... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
author: Alex Haley

quote: A little neglect may breed great mischief. ... For want of a nail  the shoe was lost  for want of a shoe  the horse was lost  for want of a horse  the battle was lost  for want of the battle  the war was lost.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Inspiration does not come like a blot  nor is it kinetic energy striving  but it comes to us slowly and quietly all the time.
author: Brenda Euland

quote: There is time enough for everything in the course of the day if you do but one thing once  but there is not time enough in the year if you will do two things at a time.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Incident piled on incident no more makes life than brick piled on brick makes a house.
author: Edith Ronald Mirrielees

quote: It's a long old road  but I know I'm gonna find the end.
author: Bessie Smith

quote: Think not because no man sees  such things will remain unseen.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Connections are made slowly  sometimes they grow underground.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: I never stop to plan. I take things step-by-step.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: There are very few human beings who receive the truth  complete and staggering  by instant illumination. Most of them acquire it fragment by fragment  on a small scale  by successive developments  cellularly  like a laborious mosaic.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Connections are made slowly  sometimes they grow underground.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Human successes  like human failures  are composed of one action at a time and achieved by one person at a time.
author: Patty H. Sampson

quote: The growth of understanding follows an ascending spiral rather than a straight line.
author: Joanna Field

quote: I look at victory as milestones on a very long highway.
author: Joan Benoit Samuelson

quote: No first step can be really great  it must of necessity possess more of prophecy than of achievement  nevertheless it is by the first step that a man marks the value  not only of his cause  but of himself.
author: Katherine Cecil Thurston

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: If  after all  men cannot always make history have a meaning  they can always act so that their own lives have one.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Every worthwhile accomplishment  big or little  has its stages of drudgery and triumph  a beginning  a struggle  and a victory.
author: Anonymous

quote: The world is moved not only by the mighty shoves of the heroes  but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.
author: Helen Keller

quote: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen  in small matters  as they are.
author: Gamaliel Bradford

quote: Backward  turn backward  O Time in your flight  Make me a child again just for tonight.
author: Elizabeth Akers Allen

quote: In time take time while time doth last  for time Is no time when time is past.
author: Anonymous

quote: Time whereof the memory of man runneth not to the contrary.
author: Sir William Blackstone

quote: Time is money.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Time was made for slaves.
author: John B. Buckstone

quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Know the true value of time  snatch  seize  and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness  no laziness  no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: O temporal O mores! O what times! what morals!
author: Cicero

quote: See Time has touched me gently in his race  And left no odious furrows in my face.
author: George Grabbe

quote: Time and tide wait for no man.
author: English proverb

quote: Do not squander time for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A stitch in time saves nine.
author: English proverb

quote: Gather ye rose-buds while ye may  Old Time is still aflying  And this same flower that smiles today  Tomorrow will be dying.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: Enjoy the present day  trusting very little to the morrow.
author: Horace

quote: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle.
author: Bible

quote: My time has not yet come.
author: Bible

quote: Better late than never.
author: Livy

quote: The signs of the times.
author: Matthew

quote: The bird of time has but a little way To flutter - and the bird is on the wing.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Time is a great legalizer  even in the field of morals.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: These are the times that try men's souls.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Time is the wisest counselor.
author: Pericles

quote: Seize time by the forelock.
author: Pittacus of Mitylene

quote: A thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past  and as a watch in the night.
author: Bible

quote: We spend our years as a tale that is told.
author: Bible

quote: An age builds up cities: an hour destroys them.
author: Seneca

quote: There's a time for all things.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The time is out of joint.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: O  call back yesterday  bid time return.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Make use of time  let not advantage slip.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A wonderful stream is the River Time  As it runs through the realms of Tears  With a faultless rhythm  and a musical rhyme  As it blends with the ocean of Years.
author: Benjamin F. Taylor

quote: Once in Persia reigned a king Who upon his signet ring Graved a maxim true and wise  Which if held before the eyes Gave him counsel at a glance Fit for every change and chance. Solemn words  and these are they: "Even this shall pass away."
author: Theodore Tilton

quote: Some hae meat  and canna eat  And some wad eat that want it  But we hae meat  and we can eat  And sae the Lord be thankit.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Here's a sigh to those who love me And a smile to those who hate  And whatever sky's above me  Here's a heart for every fate.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A cup to the dead already  -  Hurrah for the next that dies.
author: Dowling Bartholomew

quote: Dowling Drink to me only with thine eyes  And I will pledge with mine  Or leave a kiss but in the cup  And I'll not look for wine.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Here's to your good health  and your family's good health  and may you all live long and prosper.
author: Washington Irving

quote: A glass is good  and a lass is good  And a pipe to smoke in cold weather  The world is good and the people are good  And we're all good fellows together.
author: John O'Keeffe

quote: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Here is a toast that I want to give To a fellow I'll never know  To the fellow who's going to take my place When it's time for me to go.
author: Louis E. Thayer

quote: Little tube of mighty pow'r  Charmer of an idle hour  Object of my warm desire.
author: Isaac Hawkins Browne

quote: A woman is only a woman  but a good cigar is a smoke.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: For thy sake  tobacco  I Would do anything but die.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: What this country needs is a good five-cent cigar.
author: Thomas R. Marshall

quote: A cigarette is the perfect type of a perfect pleasure. It is exquisite  and it leaves one unsatisfied. What more can you want?
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: We are here today and gone tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone  He  who can call today his own: He who  secure within  can say  Tomorrow  do thy worst  for I have liv'd today.
author: John Dryden

quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tomorrow life is too late: live today.
author: Martial

quote: Tolerance is the only real test of civilization.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: Toleration is the best religion.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: It is intolerance to speak of toleration. Away with the word from the dictionary!
author: Mirabeau

quote: Live and let live.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: There is a budding tomorrow in midnight.
author: John Keats

quote: Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tomorrow! - Why  tomorrow I may be Myself with yesterday's sev'n thousand years.
